lessons.title: Introduction to Basic Patterns
lessons.description: Learn about the fundamental Kente patterns: Dame-Dame (checker) and Kubi (vertical stripes).
objectives: Understand the cultural significance of basic patterns
Learn to create the Dame-Dame pattern
Learn to create the Kubi pattern

introduction.text: Welcome to your first lesson in Kente weaving! We'll start with two essential patterns that form the foundation of Kente cloth design.

steps.title: Dame-Dame Pattern
steps.description: The checker pattern, known as Dame-Dame, represents duality in Akan philosophy - the balance between opposing forces in life.
steps.task: Create a simple Dame-Dame pattern using black and gold colors.
steps.hint: Start by placing the checker pattern block, then add black and gold color blocks.

steps.title: Pattern Spacing
steps.description: The spacing between pattern elements is crucial in Kente weaving.
steps.task: Adjust the rows and columns to create a balanced Dame-Dame pattern.
steps.hint: Try setting both rows and columns to 8 for a balanced look.

steps.title: Kubi Pattern
steps.description: The vertical stripes pattern, known as Kubi, symbolizes strength and spiritual growth.
steps.task: Create a Kubi pattern using three different colors.
steps.hint: Use the vertical stripes pattern block with contrasting colors.

challenge.title: Combine Patterns
challenge.description: Create a design that combines both Dame-Dame and Kubi patterns.

lessons.title: Color Symbolism in Kente
lessons.description: Explore the cultural significance of colors in Kente weaving.
objectives: Learn the meaning of traditional Kente colors

introduction.text: Colors in Kente cloth are not just decorative - each color carries deep cultural meaning and spiritual significance.

steps.title: Gold and Yellow
steps.description: Gold represents royalty, wealth, and high status.
steps.task: Create a pattern using gold as the primary color.
steps.hint: Gold works well as a dominant color with darker accents.

steps.title: Red and Black
steps.description: Red symbolizes spiritual energy and lifeblood, while black represents maturity and spiritual connection.
steps.task: Combine red and black in a balanced pattern.
steps.hint: Try alternating red and black in a striped pattern.

steps.title: Color Harmony
steps.description: Create harmonious combinations using traditional colors.
steps.task: Create a pattern using at least three culturally significant colors.
steps.hint: Consider the meaning of each color in your combination.

challenge.title: Cultural Color Story
challenge.description: Create a pattern whose colors tell a specific cultural story.

lessons.title: Simple Block Combinations
lessons.description: Learn to combine different blocks to create more complex patterns.

introduction.text: By combining different blocks in creative ways, we can create more complex and meaningful patterns.

steps.title: Pattern and Color Blocks
steps.description: Learn how pattern blocks interact with color blocks.
steps.task: Combine a pattern block with multiple color blocks.
steps.hint: The order of blocks affects the final pattern.

steps.title: Using Repeats
steps.description: Use the repeat block to create recurring patterns.
steps.task: Create a repeating pattern with at least two colors.
steps.hint: Try different repeat values to see how they affect the pattern.

steps.title: Size and Spacing
steps.description: Learn how row and column blocks affect pattern appearance.
steps.task: Experiment with different row and column combinations.
steps.hint: Larger numbers create more detailed patterns.

challenge.title: Creative Combinations
challenge.description: Create a unique pattern using all types of blocks.
